title: Customer & Industries PR Lead
content:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.As the Customer and Industries PR Lead, you’ll report to the Global Head of Public Relations as part of the Global Communications team. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including Public Relations, Customer Marketing, Product Marketing, and Industry Go-To-Market and Sales. 
You will own customer storytelling with media that demonstrates the real-world impact of the Snowflake Data Coud and Snowflake’s dedication to customer excellence throughout corporate, product, and ecosystem campaigns. You will play a pivotal role in shaping Snowflake’s external communications strategy to reach key industry audiences through customer storytelling, industry trends, and thought leadership. This role demands a proactive, collaborative communications expert with a track record of sourcing, spearheading, and executing successful PR programs for one or more of Snowflake's key industries including finserv, media & entertainment, retail CPG, healthcare, public sector, manufacturing, and telecom. If you are a self-starter with a knack for uncovering the storytelling gems amongst the noise, this is the role for you! 
AS THE CUSTOMER AND INDUSTRIES PR LEAD, YOU WILL OWN: 

Customer Success Storytelling: Identify and engage with Snowflake customers to create compelling stories and testimonials that highlight the key product capabilities and business value they’ve achieved with Snowflake Data Cloud across press releases, earned media articles, podcast interviews and other media channels. 
Industry Programs: Become the go-to PR expert for industry-focused campaigns globally. Develop unique stories and programs that spotlight Snowflake’s innovation through industry vertical messaging, day-to-day PR activities, and customer storytelling.
Media Engagement: Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key trade/industry and business media. Develop and pitch stories that showcase Snowflake's impact on businesses and industries. Secure positive coverage that emphasizes our customer success.
Content Creation: Craft messaging and materials that resonate with key audiences across industries, including pitches, press releases, bylines, media briefs, etc.
Thought Leadership: Stay up-to-date on industry trends in key verticals and proactively identify opportunities to position Snowflake as a technology thought leader across industries. Collaborate with internal experts to create and promote thought leadership content that establishes Snowflake as a leading force in data management and analytics. Collaborate with SMEs to craft and promote compelling content. 
Team Collaboration: Work as a key member of the broader corporate communications team, offering collaboration, ideas, and support beyond customer and industry responsibilities. 

OUR IDEAL CUSTOMER AND INDUSTRIES PR LEAD WILL HAVE: 

3-5 years of public relations experience focused on PR in one or more of Snowflake's key industries (finserv, media & entertainment, retail CPG, healthcare, public sector, manufacturing, and telecom), either in-house or with an agency.
Demonstrated ability to develop and manage relationships with industry trade media in one or more of our target industries.
Experience creating messaging and narratives, including sourcing stories opportunities, spokespeople, and driving content through to results. 
Ability to understand and translate complex technology concepts into messaging that resonates in a given industry through public relations strategies, thought leadership, and compelling stories.
Excellent written communication and creative storytelling skills 
Excellent organization skills
A proactive team-player with an entrepreneurial spirit
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience

questions.description: When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Snowflake. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Snowflake’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Snowflake, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Snowflake will share your personal data with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Snowflake to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Snowflake’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site and such transfer will be subject to appropriate safeguards under standard contractual clauses as approved by the European Union Commission and/or the Privacy Shield framework. Further information about how Snowflake processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Notice (the term “privacy notice” to be a link to our privacy notice located at https://www.snowflake.com/privacy-policy/ ). Your personal data will be retained by Snowflake as long as we determine it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. You have the right to data portability, to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. Such requests can be made by contacting us at privacy@snowflake.com.
